001package org.biopax.validator.utils;
002
003import java.util.*;
004
005public abstract class Cluster<T> {
006        
007        /**
008         * Implemented in concrete subclasses.
009         * Must be "symmetric"; may be "transitive" or not (you decide) -
010         * 
011         * @param a an object
012         * @param b another object of the same type
013         * @return true/false
014         */
015        public abstract boolean match(T a, T b);
016        
017
018        /**
019         * Puts elements into sets of "similar" ones. 
020         * Every object belongs to exactly one cluster.
021         * Clusters contain at least one object.
022         * 
023         * If concrete {@link #match(Object, Object)} method
024         * is not transitive, this produces such groups, where,
025         * match(A,B) is not necessarily true for all pairs in
026         * the same cluster, but there exists Z, such as,
027         * match(X,Z) and match(Y,Z) are true.
028         * 
029         * @see #match(Object, Object)
030         * 
031         * @param elements objects
032         * @param clusterMaxSize max. size of a cluster
033         * @return groups of objects
034         */
035        public final Set<Set<T>> cluster(Collection<T> elements, int clusterMaxSize) {
036                Set<Set<T>> clusters = new HashSet<Set<T>>();
037                for (T u : new HashSet<T>(elements)) {
038                        Set<Set<T>> toMerge = new HashSet<Set<T>>();
039                        for (Set<T> clu : clusters) {
040                                if(!clu.isEmpty() && matchAny(u, clu)) {
041                                        clu.add(u);
042                                        toMerge.add(clu);
043                                }
044                        }
045                        
046                        if(toMerge.isEmpty()) { //create a new cluster 
047                                Set<T> group = new HashSet<T>();
048                                group.add(u);
049                                clusters.add(group);
050                        } else if (toMerge.size() > 1) {
051                                // merge several groups into the first one
052                                Iterator<Set<T>> it = toMerge.iterator();
053                                Set<T> group = it.next();
054                                assert !group.isEmpty();
055                                while(it.hasNext()) {
056                                        Set<T> g = it.next();
057                                        group.addAll(g);
058                                        g.clear();
059                                }
060                        }
061                }
062                
063                //remove empty groups
064                Set<Set<T>> result = new HashSet<Set<T>>();
065                for(Set<T> clu : clusters) {
066                        if(!clu.isEmpty())
067                                result.add(clu);
068                }
069                
070                return result;
071        }
072        
073        
074        private boolean matchAny(T u, Set<T> clu) {
075                for(T t : clu) {
076                        if(match(u, t) || match(t, u))
077                                return true;
078                }
079                return false;
080        }
081        
082}
